00020 /*****************************************************************************

00022   sc_nbdefs.h -- Top level header file for arbitrary precision signed/unsigned
00023                  arithmetic. This file defines all the constants needed.

00064 #ifndef SC_NBDEFS_H
00065 #define SC_NBDEFS_H

00068 #include "sysc/kernel/sc_cmnhdr.h"
00069 
00070 #include <climits>
00071 
00072 #if defined(__sun) || defined(__sun__)
00073 #  include <inttypes.h>
00074 #elif !defined(WIN32) && !defined(_WIN32)
00075 #  include <stdint.h>
00076 #endif
00077 
00078 #include "sysc/kernel/sc_constants.h"   // For SC_MAX_NBITS
00079 
00080 // Activate support mixed operands for concatenation via the comma operator
00081 #define SC_DT_MIXED_COMMA_OPERATORS
00082 
00083 
00084 namespace sc_dt
00085 {
00086 
00087 // ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00088 //  ENUM : sc_numrep
00089 //
00090 //  Enumeration of number representations for character string conversion.
00091 // ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00092 
00093 enum sc_numrep
00094 {
00095     SC_NOBASE = 0,
00096     SC_BIN    = 2,
00097     SC_OCT    = 8,
00098     SC_DEC    = 10,
00099     SC_HEX    = 16,
00100     SC_BIN_US,
00101     SC_BIN_SM,
00102     SC_OCT_US,
00103     SC_OCT_SM,
00104     SC_HEX_US,
00105     SC_HEX_SM,
00106     SC_CSD
00107 };
00108 
00109 
00110 // Sign of a number:
00111 #define SC_NEG       -1     // Negative number
00112 #define SC_ZERO      0      // Zero
00113 #define SC_POS       1      // Positive number
00114 #define SC_NOSIGN    2      // Uninitialized sc_signed number
00115 
00116 typedef unsigned char uchar;
00117 
00118 // A small_type number is at least a char. Defining an int is probably
00119 // better for alignment.
00120 typedef int small_type;
00121 
00122 // Attributes of a byte.
00123 #define BITS_PER_BYTE   8
00124 #define BYTE_RADIX      256
00125 #define BYTE_MASK       255
00126 
00127 // LOG2_BITS_PER_BYTE = log2(BITS_PER_BYTE), assuming that
00128 // BITS_PER_BYTE is a power of 2.
00129 #define LOG2_BITS_PER_BYTE 3
00130 
00131 // Attributes of the unsigned long. These definitions are used mainly in
00132 // the functions that are aware of the internal representation of
00133 // digits, e.g., get/set_packed_rep().
00134 #define BYTES_PER_DIGIT_TYPE  4
00135 #define BITS_PER_DIGIT_TYPE   32
00136 
00137 // Attributes of a digit, i.e., unsigned long less the overflow bits.
00138 #define BYTES_PER_DIGIT 4
00139 #define BITS_PER_DIGIT  30
00140 #define DIGIT_RADIX     (1ul << BITS_PER_DIGIT)
00141 #define DIGIT_MASK      (DIGIT_RADIX - 1)
00142 // Make sure that BYTES_PER_DIGIT = ceil(BITS_PER_DIGIT / BITS_PER_BYTE).
00143 
00144 // Similar attributes for the half of a digit. Note that
00145 // HALF_DIGIT_RADIX is equal to the square root of DIGIT_RADIX. These
00146 // definitions are used mainly in the multiplication routines.
00147 #define BITS_PER_HALF_DIGIT (BITS_PER_DIGIT / 2)
00148 #define HALF_DIGIT_RADIX    (1ul << BITS_PER_HALF_DIGIT)
00149 #define HALF_DIGIT_MASK     (HALF_DIGIT_RADIX - 1)
00150 
00151 // DIV_CEIL2(x, y) = ceil(x / y). x and y are positive numbers.
00152 #define DIV_CEIL2(x, y) (((x) - 1) / (y) + 1)
00153 
00154 // DIV_CEIL(x) = ceil(x / BITS_PER_DIGIT) = the number of digits to
00155 // store x bits. x is a positive number.
00156 #define DIV_CEIL(x) DIV_CEIL2(x, BITS_PER_DIGIT)
00157 
00158 #ifdef SC_MAX_NBITS
00159 static const int MAX_NDIGITS = DIV_CEIL(SC_MAX_NBITS) + 2;
00160 // Consider a number with x bits another with y bits. The maximum
00161 // number of bits happens when we multiply them. The result will have
00162 // (x + y) bits. Assume that x + y <= SC_MAX_NBITS. Then, DIV_CEIL(x) +
00163 // DIV_CEIL(y) <= DIV_CEIL(SC_MAX_NBITS) + 2. This is the reason for +2
00164 // above. With this change, MAX_NDIGITS must be enough to hold the
00165 // result of any operation.
00166 #endif
00167 
00168 // Support for "digit" vectors used to hold the values of sc_signed,
00169 // sc_unsigned, sc_bv_base,  and sc_lv_base data types. This type is also used
00170 // in the concatenation support. An sc_digit is currently an unsigned 32-bit
00171 // quantity. The typedef used is an unsigned int, rather than an unsigned long,
00172 // since the unsigned long data type varies in size between 32-bit and 64-bit
00173 // machines.
00174 
00175 typedef unsigned int sc_digit;  // 32-bit unsigned integer
00176 
00177 // Support for the long long type. This type is not in the standard
00178 // but is usually supported by compilers.
00179 #ifndef _WIN32
00180 #   if defined(__x86_64__) || defined(__aarch64__)
00181         typedef long long          int64;
00182         typedef unsigned long long uint64;
00183 #   else
00184         typedef int64_t            int64;
00185         typedef uint64_t           uint64;
00186 #   endif
00187 #else
00188     typedef __int64            int64;
00189     typedef unsigned __int64   uint64;
00190 #endif
00191 
00192 #if !defined(_WIN32) || defined(__MINGW32__)
00193     static const uint64 UINT64_ZERO   = 0ULL;
00194     static const uint64 UINT64_ONE    = 1ULL;
00195     static const uint64 UINT64_32ONES = 0x00000000ffffffffULL;
00196 #else
00197     static const uint64 UINT64_ZERO   = 0i64;
00198     static const uint64 UINT64_ONE    = 1i64;
00199     static const uint64 UINT64_32ONES = 0x00000000ffffffffi64;
00200 #endif
00201 
00202 
00203 // Bits per ...
00204 // will be deleted in the future. Use numeric_limits instead
00205 #define BITS_PER_CHAR    8
00206 #define BITS_PER_INT    (sizeof(int) * BITS_PER_CHAR)
00207 #define BITS_PER_LONG   (sizeof(long) * BITS_PER_CHAR)
00208 #define BITS_PER_INT64  (sizeof(::sc_dt::int64) * BITS_PER_CHAR)
00209 #define BITS_PER_UINT   (sizeof(unsigned int) * BITS_PER_CHAR)
00210 #define BITS_PER_ULONG  (sizeof(unsigned long) * BITS_PER_CHAR)
00211 #define BITS_PER_UINT64 (sizeof(::sc_dt::uint64) * BITS_PER_CHAR)
00212 
00213 // Digits per ...
00214 #define DIGITS_PER_CHAR   1
00215 #define DIGITS_PER_INT    ((BITS_PER_INT+29)/30)
00216 #define DIGITS_PER_LONG   ((BITS_PER_LONG+29)/30)
00217 #define DIGITS_PER_INT64  ((BITS_PER_INT64+29)/30)
00218 #define DIGITS_PER_UINT   ((BITS_PER_UINT+29)/30)
00219 #define DIGITS_PER_ULONG  ((BITS_PER_ULONG+29)/30)
00220 #define DIGITS_PER_UINT64 ((BITS_PER_UINT64+29)/30)
00221 
00222 // Above, BITS_PER_X is mainly used for sc_signed, and BITS_PER_UX is
00223 // mainly used for sc_unsigned.
00224 
00225 static const small_type NB_DEFAULT_BASE = SC_DEC;
00226 
00227 // For sc_int code:
00228 
00229     typedef int64 int_type;
00230     typedef uint64 uint_type;
00231 #   define SC_INTWIDTH 64
00232     static const uint64 UINT_ZERO = UINT64_ZERO;
00233     static const uint64 UINT_ONE = UINT64_ONE;
00234 
00235 } // namespace sc_dt
00236 
00237 #endif
